subject: Re: WMSD tool uploads
preview: Hi Victoria,Sure, all good now on this one.

full_threads.body:
Hi Victoria,

Sure, all good now on this one.

Thanks a lot Joel.

There's a blue box on the home page across all five languages that says we'll be sharing more info and resources in spring 2019. Could this be removed from all the home pages please.

Many thanks
Victoria

Many thanks.




Victoria Gilbert

Head of International Communications and Campaigns, Multiple Sclerosis International Federation (MSIF)

+44 (0) 20 7620 1911 | victoria@msif.org | http://www.msif.org/

Hi Victoria,

Sure, all good now on this one.

Hi Joel,

Thank you.

Could you add '(français)' after the French hyperlink on the English page, so that it's consistent with the others.

Many thanks,
Victoria

Hi Victoria,

Confirming all the change request are now done.

https://worldmsday.org/tools/
https://worldmsday.org/ar/toolkit-page/
https://worldmsday.org/fr/toolkit-page/
https://worldmsday.org/es/toolkit-page/
https://worldmsday.org/pt-pt/toolkit-page/

Brilliant, thanks Joel. The corrected Arabic tools are now ready so can be uploaded (Arabic: How to get involved poster, infographic large version, infographic 5, infographic 7) Could you also swap the Spanish infographic 7 for the updated one in the folder. See here. Could we hide the tools 2018 page? They just came up on our monitoring for some reason. On the website - Spanish page:
  • Tools tab in menu currently reads as Ferramentas - this is Portuguese. The Spanish translation is Herramientas.
  • Remove the final n in this sentence: Todo el que quiera marcar la diferencia en las vidas de las personas afectadas por la EM pueden utilizar estos recursos como deseen (remove this final 'n')
  • 'What I want you to know about MS' heading. The words have got jumbled. Could this say:
  • Plantilla 'Lo que quiero que sepas acerca de la EM'
On the French page: - Under the heading 'Images pour les réseaux sociaux' - the first tool needs to say 'celle-ci pour Facebook et Twitter' at the end and the second tool need to say 'celle-ci pour Instagram' - Under the heading 'Titres pour les réseaux sociaux', the first tool needs to say 'Facebook' (instead of Instagram) and the second tool needs to say 'Twitter' (instead of Facebook) Finally, on the English tools page, the French link still hasn't been hyperlinked. Could it be updated please. Many thanks Victoria Victoria Gilbert Head of International Communications and Campaigns, Multiple Sclerosis International Federation (MSIF) +44 (0) 20 7620 1911 | victoria@msif.org | http://www.msif.org/

Hi Victoria,

Sure no worries! 

Regarding the changes we have finished:
- we have removed the text ('We'll be sharing more information and resources in Spring 2019. Watch this space!') for all the languages
- French hyperlinks are done. 
- Removed the arabic tools image
'how to get involved' poster
Infographic complete (large version with all infographics combined)
Infographic 5
Infographic 

Just send us the updated images so we could upload it.

Hi Joel,


Thanks very much for doing this (and for working at night for us! Huge thanks to you).


Across all the language pages, can you delete the final line of the description at the top of the page that says 'We'll be sharing more information and resources in Spring 2019. Watch this space!'


Can you also hyperlink the text (see screengrab below) to all the languages. The French still needs to be hyperlinked on the English page. This also needs to be done for all the languages the French page (no languages are currently showing)




They've spotted an issue with the following Arabic tools. Please could you delete them from the Arabic page only:

- 'how to get involved' poster

- Infographic complete (large version with all infographics combined)

- Infographic 5

- Infographic 7


I'm just getting my colleagues to check the other language versions but hopefully they're all good (Arabic often causes issues!).


Many thanks,

Victoria




Victoria Gilbert

Head of International Communications and Campaigns, Multiple Sclerosis International Federation (MSIF)

+44 (0) 20 7620 1911 | victoria@msif.org| http://www.msif.org/


**direct**

Hi Victoria,

All good now on the changes.
You can check now and let us know if this is ok?

https://worldmsday.org/tools/
https://worldmsday.org/ar/toolkit-page/
https://worldmsday.org/fr/toolkit-page/
https://worldmsday.org/es/toolkit-page/
https://worldmsday.org/pt-pt/toolkit-page/

Hi Joel,


Thanks so much for this - the pages look great.


The horizontal coloured logo is coming out in the wrong colours across the languages. Do you know why this might be? It should be in RGB. Can you check it's this one for Portuguese, this one for French, this one for Arabic and this one for Spanish.


English


- How to get involved - the description still needs to be added

- Logos:

o The English horizontal logo is here

o could you change the title in English to 'Logos and hashtag'


French:

- Social media headers - our translators put Instagram in the description, when it should say Twitter. Could you change the word Instagram to Twitter please? Thank you


Spanish

- There are still too many web banners. In the heading could you delete the word 'fotos y' too.



Many thanks

Victoria



Victoria Gilbert

Head of International Communications and Campaigns, Multiple Sclerosis International Federation (MSIF)

+44 (0) 20 7620 1911 | victoria@msif.org | http://www.msif.org/

Hi Victoria,

Sure, we updated the tools images. For the english page we are currently missing a logo on "Logos section - 30 May horizontal colour jpg". Can you send it to me so we could upload it?

https://worldmsday.org/tools/
https://worldmsday.org/ar/toolkit-page/
https://worldmsday.org/fr/toolkit-page/
https://worldmsday.org/es/toolkit-page/
https://worldmsday.org/pt-pt/toolkit-page/

Hi Joel,


Thanks very much for this. A few too many tools have been uploaded. See below the instructions. Could you delete the website banners, hashtags and logos, except those listed below?


· Website banner x1 (just include the first header - not the alternative versions)

· Hashtag v8 and v3

· Logos x3 in total (30 May horizontal colour jpg; 30 May horizontal b&w; 30 May stacked colour jpg.


Many thanks

Victoria



Victoria Gilbert

Head of International Communications and Campaigns, Multiple Sclerosis International Federation (MSIF)

+44 (0) 20 7620 1911 | victoria@msif.org | http://www.msif.org/


**direct**

Hi Victoria,

We have updated images for tools page and link the new tools page on the menu: 
https://worldmsday.org/tools/
https://worldmsday.org/ar/toolkit-page/
https://worldmsday.org/fr/toolkit-page/
https://worldmsday.org/es/toolkit-page/
https://worldmsday.org/pt-pt/toolkit-page/

Let me know if this is ok?

action.text: Joel Maligalig assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
Hi Heath,

I hope the uploading is going ok. Please could you also check that all the language hyperlinks are working across the different tool pages.

On the English tool page, it looked like French hadn’t been hyperlinked and I think this still needs to be done on the other language tool pages too.

Many thanks
Victoria

_____________________________
From: Victoria Gilbert <victoria@msif.org>
Sent: Tuesday, February 26, 2019 17:02
Subject: RE: WMSD tool uploads
To: Heath Maguire - Wolf IQ <heath@wolfiq.com.au>


Hi Heath,

Thank you for this.

All the remaining tools in Arabic, Spanish, Portuguese and French have now been uploaded tothis folder.

The English posters have also been amended slightly. Please could you upload the English posters, found inthis folder.

Can you make sure you include the correct heading and description (the text underneath each tool), as detailed in the Excel sheet attached. Note that under some headings, the descriptions varies slightly for each tool.

Thank you for your help with this and for the quick turn-around.

All the best,
Victoria

Victoria Gilbert
Head of International Communications and Campaigns, Multiple Sclerosis International Federation (MSIF)
+44 (0) 20 7620 1911| victoria@msif.org| www.msif.org

From: Heath Maguire - Wolf IQ <heath@wolfiq.com.au>
Sent: 26 February 2019 07:22
To: Victoria Gilbert <victoria@msif.org>
Subject: Re: WMSD tool uploads

Hi Victoria,

Ok sure, we will do our best to meet Wednesday morning UK time. The sooner you can get the files to us the better.

Thanks,
HEATH MAGUIRE
CREATIVE DIRECTOR -WOLFIQ.COM.AU

E.heath@wolfiq.com.au | P. 1300 072 134 | M.0415 162 271





On 26 Feb 2019, at 6:03 am, Victoria Gilbert <victoria@msif.org> wrote:

Hi Heath,

Ah ok, I understand - no problem. In that case we will have to pay the rush fee.

The designer’s making a few final edits to the remaining tools (we’re having issues with those tricky accents in Spanish and the Arabic letters!), so I’ll send them to you tomorrow.

If we pay the rush fee, will it be ok to have the tools uploaded by Wednesday morning (UK time)?

Thanks very much for your help with this – appreciate your time!

Victoria

Victoria Gilbert
Head of International Communications and Campaigns, Multiple Sclerosis International Federation (MSIF)
+44 (0) 20 7620 1911 | victoria@msif.org | www.msif.org

From: Heath Maguire - Wolf IQ <heath@wolfiq.com.au>
Sent: 25 February 2019 08:47
To: Victoria Gilbert <victoria@msif.org>
Subject: Re: WMSD tool uploads

Hi Victoria,

Sure, thanks for getting back to me. We will be able to fit this in on Friday (Sydney time) if there is no rush fee as we are fully booked this week. If I can squeeze it in earlier, we certainly will.

Please send through the final versions of the outstanding ones once they are back.

Thanks and speak soon,
HEATH MAGUIRE
CREATIVE DIRECTOR - WOLFIQ.COM.AU

E. heath@wolfiq.com.au | P. 1300 072 134 | M. 0415 162 271






On 25 Feb 2019, at 6:41 pm, Victoria Gilbert <victoria@msif.org> wrote:

Hi Heath,

Let me know if everything’s ok on this and if you have any questions.

Many thanks,
Victoria





On Sun, Feb 24, 2019 at 9:19 AM +0000, "Victoria Gilbert" <victoria@msif.org> wrote:

Hi Heath,

Thanks for getting back to me on this. If we extend it to end of Tuesday for the tools to be uploaded, would this remove the rush fee?

I’ve had the tools back from our designer. There are a couple of errors on two of the tools (mainly fonts and accent symbols), so the design agency will work on them Monday and I’ll get the remaining two to you asap. I’m sending the instructions now as I wasn’t sure if you’d prefer to upload all in one go or get ahead by uploading the majority of tools that we already have.

See attached the tool headings and descriptions, that need to accompany the tools in the five languages.

See below the tools that are ready to be uploaded (in the correct order below) and those that will be ready Tuesday (AUS Tues). Please can you use the final files from this folder: https://www.dropbox.com/sh/sti5p9jrggswc2l/AAAi9hficqJ2f8iGHeAP4NQXa?dl=0

Spanish, French, Arabic, Portuguese (final files)
- UNFINISHED – do not upload. Will send you final versions tomorrow: How to get involved
- UNFINISHED – do not upload. Will send you final versions tomorrow: Invisible symptom posters
- READY: Myth and truth infographics
- READY: ‘What I want you to know about my MS’ graphic
- READY: Social media shareables
- READY: Social media headers
- READY: Website banner x1 (just include the first header – not the alternative versions)
- READY: Hashtag v8 and v3
- READYAY: Logos x3 in total (30 May horizontal colour jpg; 30 May horizontal b&w; 30 May stacked colour jpg.

Many thanks for your help with this. Let me know if you have any questions.

All the best,
Victoria



From: Heath Maguire - Wolf IQ <heath@wolfiq.com.au>
Sent: 21 February 2019 22:59
To: Victoria Gilbert <victoria@msif.org>
Subject: Re: WMSD tool uploads

Hi Victoria,

Ok, we can do it on Monday, but we will have to add a rush fee of an additional 50%, as we will be working outside of normal hours to accommodate the request.

We added in the other languages to get a head start as the requests that come through this time of year tend to have a quick turnaround. It’s not a problem, just us being proactive and trying to keep up.

So invoice #1109 is for 6 hours. Included in this is 4 hours for the Arabic, French, Spanish and Portuguese uploads. This means there will be an additional 2 hour fee ($99x2) to push it through on Monday, a total invoice of $792.00. Please confirm that this is ok for you?

Thanks and speak soon,
